alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 28 at 12:20AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Warrick, northeastern Vanderburgh, southeastern Gibson and southern Pike Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT/100 AM EDT/... At 1119 PM CDT/1219 AM EDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winslow to Oakland City to near Haubstadt. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oakland City around 1125 PM CDT. Winslow around 1225 AM EDT. Lynnville around 1130 PM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 18 and 37. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 21 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
